page.title: 13A DAY IN HARVEST cont.
page.content: The drive home takes 10 mins. arriving home at 11.15am in time to make coffee for my husband and his secretary. I had left the washing machine going so I hung-out the washing, did some house work and prepared lunch. I am very fond of gardening, so after lunch I started some weeding but after an hour I had to take one of the tractor drivers to the casualty dept. of the hospital in Bury for an ex-ray following an accident on the farm, luckily he only sprained his ankle. This took 2 hours. Arrived home in time for tea with my husband. Started to prepare supper, boiled ham, carrots, onions, potatoes and runner beans followed by plum crumble and custard, all the vegetables being grown in our own garden. My son and husband come in about 9.00pm after they have bathed we have supper. Days are long during harvest for a farmer's wife.
